page.title: 15THE COTSWOLD HUNT
page.content: Mr Unwin is the master of the hunt and he lives in Coberley. The Cotswold hunt comes round this area. The Cotswold hunt was started in 1858.We saw the hounds they were very big and they licked my hand. There were about 55 couples and about 110 altogether. The kennels used to be in Cheltenham in Waddon road. When the hounds wag their tails it is called waving their sterns. Foxes tails are called brushes. We saw the place where the frozen meat that the hounds eat was kept. It was a very smelly place beca- se dead sheep were strung up all over the place and there were two big deep freezes. We looked into one of them, inside there were piles of dead sheep. They had no skin and they looked horr- id. Then we went to see the puppies they were cute they were chewing their ears we went back to school.
